pageIntro: Here you will find important words from the blockchain world and from the Stellar network. Everything is explained in simple terms.
searchHint: The search finds words and explanations.

blockchain.title: Blockchain
blockchain.short: Shared digital ledger - many computers store the same entries.
blockchain.desc: A blockchain is like a digital ledger. Many computers store the same entries, which prevents anyone from secretly making changes.

wallet.title: Wallet
wallet.short: Digital wallet that manages your keys.
wallet.desc: A wallet is your digital purse. It manages the keys you need to access your account and send transactions. A wallet can be a program, an app, or even just a piece of paper with your private key.

account.title: Account
account.short: A blockchain account can hold assets and send transactions.
account.desc: An account is the place on the blockchain where your assets are stored. An account has a public address that begins with G. Multiple wallets can access the same account if they have the correct key.

addressG.title: G-address
addressG.short: The public main address of a Stellar account (begins with G).
addressG.desc: The G-address is the main address of a Stellar account. It starts with the letter G. You give it to others so they can send you something.

publicKey.title: Public key
publicKey.short: Address that you are allowed to share; usually the G-address in Stellar.
publicKey.desc: The public key is the address you are allowed to share. In Stellar, this is the G-address. Others use it to send you money.

privateKey.title: Secret key
privateKey.short: Password for the account - never share it.
privateKey.desc: The secret key is your password for the account. Anyone who has this key can move your money. Never share it.

addressFederation.title: Federation address
addressFederation.short: Short address like email points to a G‑address.
addressFederation.desc: A federation address looks like an email. For example: name*domain.com. This short address points to a regular G-address. It is easier to remember.

addressMuxed.title: Muxed account
addressMuxed.short: M-address with additional ID – shares a base account.
addressMuxed.desc: An M-address points to an existing Stellar account but also has its own number (ID). This allows, for example, distinguishing between multiple individuals or departments under the same G-address. Technically, the funds still belong to the main account.

multisig.title: Multisignature
multisig.short: Important actions require more than a signature.
multisig.desc: Multi-Sig stands for multiple signatures. An important action requires more than one key. For example, you and a second key both need to agree before something can be sent. This makes theft more difficult.

trustline.title: Trustline
trustline.short: Consent to hold a token from a specific issuer.
trustline.desc:
A trustline is like a "Yes, I accept this token." By doing so, you indicate that your account is ready to hold a specific token from a specific issuer. Without a trustline, you cannot receive this token.

Example: A trustline is specified as CODE:ISSUER. For EURT from the issuer GDUKMGUGDZQK6Y…, it is EURT:GDUKMGUGDZQK6Y…

token.title: Token
token.short: Digital unit – e.g., money, points, or credit.
token.desc: A token is a digital unit on the blockchain. A token can represent money, points, or credits for a service.

asset.title: Asset
asset.short: Tokens on Stellar are always linked to an issuer.
asset.desc: On Stellar, a token is called an asset. An asset is always linked to an issuing account. For example, an account can issue a Euro token. This Euro token is then an asset.

xlm.title: XLM
xlm.short: Native currency of Stellar for fees and activation.
xlm.desc: XLM is the native currency of Stellar. You need XLM to pay fees and to open a new account.

mainnet.title: Mainnet
mainnet.short: Real Stellar network with real value.
mainnet.desc: The real Stellar network with actual value. Transactions are final, and fees are paid in real XLM.

testnet.title: Testnet
testnet.short: Public practice network without real value.
testnet.desc: A public practice network. Tokens have no real value. Ideal for learning and experimenting without risk.

memo.title: Memo
memo.desc: A memo is a small note that you can send along with a transaction. Often, an exchange requires a specific memo so that it knows to whom the money belongs.

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.short: Action on the blockchain, e.g., payment or trustline.
transaction.desc: A transaction is an action on the blockchain. For example, sending money or setting up a trustline. A transaction is permanently recorded once it is confirmed.

fee.title: Fee
fee.desc: The fee is a very small amount you pay with each transaction. The fee goes to the network. With Stellar, the fees are very small.

ledger.title: Ledger
ledger.short: Chain of confirmed data and account balances.
ledger.desc: The ledger is the chain of all confirmed data. It shows which accounts own how much and what transactions have occurred. Anyone can inspect the ledger.

horizon.title: Horizon
horizon.short: API service through which apps interact with Stellar.
horizon.desc: Horizon is the service through which programs interact with the Stellar blockchain. Our tool queries Horizon to load account balances and transactions.

anchor.title: Anchor
anchor.short: Company that connects fiat money with Stellar.
anchor.desc: An anchor is a company that connects real money like euros or dollars with Stellar. For example, you give the anchor euros and receive a euro token on Stellar in return.

exchange.title: Stock Exchange
exchange.short: Place to buy and sell tokens.
exchange.desc: An exchange is a place where you can buy or sell tokens. Many exchanges require a KYC process, which means identity verification, before you can withdraw money in euros or francs.

dex.title: DEX
dex.short: Decentralized exchange directly on the blockchain.
dex.desc: DEX stands for Decentralized Exchange. Here, people trade directly with each other on the blockchain. There is no single operator. Stellar has a DEX built directly into it.

liquidityPool.title: Liquidity pool
liquidityPool.short: Shared pool with two tokens for immediate exchange.
liquidityPool.desc: A liquidity pool is a shared pool consisting of two tokens. People deposit both tokens into it, allowing others to instantly exchange these tokens. The depositors earn small fees for this service.

balanceClaimable.title: Claimable Balance
balanceClaimable.short: Reserved funds that you still need to accept.
balanceClaimable.desc: A Claimable Balance is money that is already reserved for you, but you still need to claim it. It only gets added to your account once you accept it.

protocolUpdate.title: Protocol Update
protocolUpdate.desc: A Protocol Update is an upgrade of the rules in the Stellar network, such as new functionalities or security changes. All nodes in the network must use the same rules.

soroban.title: Soroban
soroban.desc: Soroban is Stellar's smart contract system. A smart contract is program code on the blockchain. The code can independently verify rules and trigger actions without a bank as an intermediary.
